derivation: a primary verb (perhaps rather akin to the base of G4474 (ῥίπτω), through the idea of sudden motion);
strongs_def: to fling (properly, with a quick toss, thus differing from G906 (ῥίπτω), which denotes a deliberate hurl; and from (see in G1614 (ῥίπτω)), which indicates an extended projection); by qualification, to deposit (as if a load); by extension, to disperse
outline:
1. to cast, throw
  2. throw down
  3. to cast forward or before
  4. to set down (with the suggestion of haste and want of care)
  5. to throw to the ground, prostrate
